biolockj

Class Pipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.Pipeline

  • public class Pipeline
extends Object
    This class initializes and executes each BioModule configured for execution.
    BioModules that generate scripts are monitored until all scripts are complete, before moving on to the next module.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String BLJ_COMPLETE
      Name of the file created in the BioModule or "internal.pipelineDir" root directory to indicate execution was successful: "biolockjComplete"
      static String BLJ_FAILED
      Name of the file created in the "internal.pipelineDir" root directory to indicate fatal application errors halted execution: "biolockjFailed"
      static String BLJ_STARTED
      Name of the file created in the BioModule root directory to indicate execution has started: "biolockjStarted"
      static String SCRIPT_FAILURES
      File suffix appended to failed scripts: "Failures"
      static String SCRIPT_STARTED
      File suffix appended to started script: "Started"
      static String SCRIPT_SUCCESS
      File suffix appended to successful scripts: "Success"

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static void executeModules()
      This method executes all new and incomplete modules
      Before/after a module is executed, set persistent module status by creating status indicator files.
      protected static File getMetadata(BioModule bioModule)
      If the bioModule is complete and contains a metadata file in its output directory, return the metadata file, since it must be a new version.
      static List<BioModule> getModules()
      Return a list of BioModules constructed by the BioModuleFactory
      static String getStatus()
      Return "Success" if no pipelineException has been thrown, otherwise return "Failures"
      protected static boolean initializeModules()
      Initialization occurs by calling BioModule methods on configured modules
      Create module sub-directories under "internal.pipelineDir" as ordered in Config file.
      Reset the SummaryUtil module so previous summary descriptions can be used for completed modules Delete incomplete module contents if restarting a failed pipeline "output" directory
      Call refreshMetadataCache(File) to cache initial metadata or (if restarting) cache the updated version found in a completed module output directory
      Verify dependencies with BioModule.checkDependencies().
      static void initializePipeline()
      This method initializes the Pipeline by building the modules and checking module dependencies.
      protected static boolean poll(ScriptModule module)
      The ScriptModule.getScriptDir() will contain one main script and one ore more worker scripts.
      An empty file with "Started" appended to the script name is created when execution begins.
      If successful, an empty file with "Success" appended to the script name is created.
      Upon failure, an empty file with "Failures" appended to the script name is created.
      Script status is polled each minute, determining status by counting indicator files.
      Log outputs the # of started, failed, and successful scripts (if any change).
      Log repeats the previous message every 10 minutes if no status change is detected.
      If ScriptModule.SCRIPT_EXIT_ON_ERROR = "Y", the pipeline will fail if any script error occurs.
      protected static void refreshMetadataCache(File metadata)
      Call MetaUtil to refresh the metadata cache.
      static void runDirectModule(String moduleName)
      If moduleName is null, run all modules, otherwise only run the specified module.
      static void runPipeline()
      This method initializes and executes the BioModules set in the BioLockJ configuration file.

        public static String getStatus()
                        throws Exception

        Returns:
        pipeline status (success or failed)
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to get status for all modules

        Throws:

      • runDirectModule

        public static void runDirectModule(String moduleName)
                            throws Exception
        If moduleName is null, run all modules, otherwise only run the specified module.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Name of a single module to run
        Throws:
        Exception - if any fatal error occurs during execution

      • runPipeline

        public static void runPipeline()
                        throws Exception
        This method initializes and executes the BioModules set in the BioLockJ configuration file.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any fatal error occurs during execution

      • executeModules

        protected static void executeModules()
                              throws Exception
        This method executes all new and incomplete modules
        Before/after a module is executed, set persistent module status by creating status indicator files. Incomplete modules have an empty file "biolockjStarted" in the module directory.
        Complete modules have an empty file "biolockjComplete" in the module directory.
        BioModules are run in the order listed in the Config file.

        Execution steps:

        1. File "biolockjStarted" is added to the module directory
        2. Execute refreshMetadataCache(File) to update metadata cache if a new metadata file was generated by the previous module.
        3. Run module scripts, if any, polling 1/minute for status until all scripts complete or time out.
        4. File "biolockjStarted" is removed to the module directory
        5. File "biolockjComplete" is added to the module directory
        Throws:
        Exception - if script errors occur

      • getMetadata

        protected static File getMetadata(BioModule bioModule)
        If the bioModule is complete and contains a metadata file in its output directory, return the metadata file, since it must be a new version.
        Parameters:
        bioModule - BioModule
        Returns:
        New metadata file (or null)

      • initializeModules

        protected static boolean initializeModules()
                                    throws Exception
        Initialization occurs by calling BioModule methods on configured modules
        1. Create module sub-directories under "internal.pipelineDir" as ordered in Config file.
        2. Reset the SummaryUtil module so previous summary descriptions can be used for completed modules
        3. Delete incomplete module contents if restarting a failed pipeline "output" directory
        4. Call refreshMetadataCache(File) to cache initial metadata or (if restarting) cache the updated version found in a completed module output directory
        5. Verify dependencies with BioModule.checkDependencies().
        Returns:
        true if no errors are thrown
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if propagated by called methods

      • poll

        protected static boolean poll(ScriptModule module)
                       throws Exception
        The ScriptModule.getScriptDir() will contain one main script and one ore more worker scripts.
        An empty file with "Started" appended to the script name is created when execution begins.
        If successful, an empty file with "Success" appended to the script name is created.
        Upon failure, an empty file with "Failures" appended to the script name is created.
        Script status is polled each minute, determining status by counting indicator files.
        Log outputs the # of started, failed, and successful scripts (if any change).
        Log repeats the previous message every 10 minutes if no status change is detected.
        If ScriptModule.SCRIPT_EXIT_ON_ERROR = "Y", the pipeline will fail if any script error occurs.
        Parameters:
        module - ScriptModule
        Returns:
        true if all scripts are complete, regardless of status
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown to end pipeline execution

      • refreshMetadataCache

        protected static void refreshMetadataCache(File metadata)
                                    throws Exception
        Call MetaUtil to refresh the metadata cache.
        Parameters:
        metadata - Metadata file
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to refresh the cache
